page.title: 10BOAT BUILDING AT HURLEY
page.content: {FREEBODY'S THE BOAT BUILDERS OF {HURLEY. The Freebody family trace their ancestors living in Hurley back to 1533.They employ 21 people in all as they have 2 other boat building workshops. They build only wooden boats importing teak from Thailand or Burma and mahogany from West Africa.They also use English oak and pine.They probably only build completely 2 boats a year though 300 on average come in for repair. They unusually today,build boats with steam engines.Their customers include Americans,Italians and Swiss. Freebody's pride themselves on the craftsmanship of their work.
